MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SkipXmlCompatibilityProcessing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.SkipXmlCompatibilityProcessing : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值确定读取器是否应与如何处理标记兼容性内容这一默认 行为有所区别。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the reader should differ from the default behavior of how markup compatibility content is processed.

value.span: 如果直接使用启动读取器（这意味着将 XML 兼容性标记作为主要流的一部分进行处理，而不考虑兼容性），则为 。

span.span: if the initiating reader is directly used, which means that XML compatibility markup is processed as part of the main stream and compatibility is not considered.

value.span: 如果使用默认行为（即单独处理 XML 兼容性），则为 。

span.span: if the default behavior is used, which processes XML compatibility separately.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认处理行为中的 XML 标记兼容性在于，如提供进行初始化，包装在创建内部帮助器类。The default handling behavior for XML markup compatibility in is that the , as provided for initialization, is wrapped in a created internal helper class. 此帮助器类单独读取的标记兼容性节点，并进入基于架构上下文的标记兼容性的节点。This helper class reads the markup compatibility nodes separately and enters into the nodes based on markup compatibility of the schema context. 设置的情况下，建议到`true`是：Suggested scenarios for setting to `true` are: - 想要保留主 XAML 流中的任何标记兼容性的内容。You want to keep any markup compatibility content in the primary XAML stream. - 已经处理标记兼容因为正在使用的读取器可以处理标记兼容性内联的内容。You have already processed the markup compatibility because you are using a reader that can process markup compatibility content inline. - 选择要忽略的原因的性能在 XAML 读取器实现中的 XML 兼容性约定。You choose to ignore XML compatibility conventions in your XAML reader implementation for reasons of performance.

summary.span: 获取或设置语言设置值，该值确定读取器可能提升到在节点中写出 特性的编写器。

span.span: Gets or sets the language setting value that the reader may promote to writers that write attributes in nodes.

value.span: 要用于基于读取器的可能 输出的字符串。

span.span: The string to use for possible output that is based on the reader.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用方负责确保提供的字符串适用于`xml:lang`使用情况。The caller is responsible for making sure that the string you provide is appropriate for `xml:lang` usage.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值确定 XAML 读取器是否让任何 XAML 编写器在节点中写入 特性。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the XAML reader instructs any XAML writers to write attributes in nodes.

summary.span: 如果需要该行为，则此信息会通过共享 XAML 架构上下文传递。

span.span: If that behavior is desired, this information is passed through shared XAML schema context.

value.span: 如果正在处理 XAML 节点流的编写器可以编写xml: space ="preserve"中输出;如果属性不能在节点中写入。

span.span: if writers that are processing the XAML node stream can write xml:space="preserve" in output; if attributes cannot be written in nodes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks XML 空白概念不强大，足以适用于 XAML，XAML 读取器通常被忽略。The XML white-space concepts are not robust enough to apply to XAML and are typically ignored by XAML readers.
